intro: Xyris valdeapiculata, commonly known as the narrowleaf yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xyridaceae, which includes various species of grass-like plants. The plant features grass-like leaves and produces yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps, preferring moist, sandy soils. Xyris valdeapiculata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate periodic flooding and salt spray.
